intro: Dalechampia juruana, commonly known as the Amazonian sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments along riverbanks and in dense forest understories. Its latex sap is known to be toxic and has been used traditionally by indigenous communities for various purposes.
